element.definition: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.
element.comment: Virtual encounters can be recorded in the Encounter by specifying a location reference to a location of type "kind" such as "client's home" and an encounter.class = "virtual".

element.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.
The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.
element.comment: When the patient is no longer active at a location, then the period end date is entered, and the status may be changed to completed.

binding.description: The status of the location.

element.short: Time period during which the patient was present at the location
element.definition: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

element.short: The custodian organization of this Encounter record
element.definition: An organization that is in charge of maintaining the information of this Encounter (e.g. who maintains the report or the master service catalog item, etc.). This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different. This MAY not be not the Service Delivery Location's Organization.

mapping.map: PV1-10 / PL.6  & PL.1  (note: HL7 v2 definition is "the treatment or type of surgery that the patient is scheduled to receive"; seems slightly out of alignment with the concept name 'hospital service'. Would not trust that implementations apply this semantic by default)

element.short: Another Encounter this encounter is part of
element.definition: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).
element.comment: This is also used for associating a child's encounter back to the mother's encounter.Refer to the Notes section in the Patient resource for further details.

element.short: The technical details of an endpoint that can be used for electronic services
element.definition: The technical details of an endpoint that can be used for electronic services, such as for web services providing XDS.b or a REST endpoint for another FHIR server. This may include any security context information.

element.short: Identifies this endpoint across multiple systems
element.definition: Identifier for the organization that is used to identify the endpoint across multiple disparate systems.

element.short: active | suspended | error | off | entered-in-error | test
element.definition: active | suspended | error | off | test.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the endpoint as not currently valid.

binding.description: The status of the endpoint

element.short: Protocol/Profile/Standard to be used with this endpoint connection
element.definition: A coded value that represents the technical details of the usage of this endpoint, such as what WSDLs should be used in what way. (e.g. XDS.b/DICOM/cds-hook).
element.comment: For additional connectivity details for the protocol, extensions will be used at this point, as in the XDS example.

element.short: A name that this endpoint can be identified by
element.definition: A friendly name that this endpoint can be referred to with.

element.short: Organization that manages this endpoint (may not be the organization that exposes the endpoint)
element.definition: The organization that manages this endpoint (even if technically another organisation is hosting this in the cloud, it is the organisation associated with the data).
element.comment: This property is not typically used when searching for Endpoint resources for usage. The typical usage is via the reference from an aplicable Organization/Location/Practitioner resource, which is where the context is provided. Multiple Locations may reference a single endpoint, and don't have to be within the same organization resource, but most likely within the same organizational hierarchy.

element.definition: Contact details for a human to contact about the subscription. The primary use of this for system administrator troubleshooting.

element.short: Interval the endpoint is expected to be operational
element.definition: The interval during which the endpoint is expected to be operational.

element.short: The type of content that may be used at this endpoint (e.g. XDS Discharge summaries)
element.definition: The payload type describes the acceptable content that can be communicated on the endpoint.
element.comment: The payloadFormat describes the serialization format of the data, where the payloadType indicates the specific document/schema that is being transferred; e.g. DischargeSummary or CarePlan.

element.short: Mimetype to send. If not specified, the content could be anything (including no payload, if the connectionType defined this)
element.definition: The mime type to send the payload in - e.g. application/fhir+xml, application/fhir+json. If the mime type is not specified, then the sender could send any content (including no content depending on the connectionType).
element.comment: Sending the payload has obvious security consequences. The server is responsible for ensuring that the content is appropriately secured.

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.short: The technical base address for connecting to this endpoint
element.definition: The uri that describes the actual end-point to connect to.
element.comment:
For rest-hook, and websocket, the end-point must be an http: or https: URL; for email, a mailto: url, for sms, a tel: url, and for message the endpoint can be in any form of url the server understands (usually, http: or mllp:). The URI is allowed to be relative; in which case, it is relative to the server end-point (since their may be more than one, clients should avoid using relative URIs)

This address will be to the service base, without any parameters, or sub-services or resources tacked on.

E.g. for a WADO-RS endpoint, the url should be "https://pacs.hospital.org/wado-rs"

and not "https://pacs.hospital.org/wado-rs/studies/1.2.250.1.59.40211.12345678.678910/series/1.2.250.1.59.40211.789001276.14556172.67789/instances/...".

element.short: Usage depends on the channel type
element.definition: Additional headers / information to send as part of the notification.
element.comment: Exactly what these mean depend on the channel type. The can convey additional information to the recipient and/or meet security requirements.

element.short: Defines behaviour and contraints on the ValueSet Expansion operation
element.definition: Resource to define constraints on the Expansion of a FHIR ValueSet.

element.short: Logical URI to reference this expansion profile (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this expansion profile when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this expansion profile is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the expansion profile. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
element.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid:, but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same url if they have a distinct version.
element.requirements: Allows the expansion profile to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier.

element.short: Additional identifier for the expansion profile
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this expansion profile when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, e.g., to identify this expansion profile outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.
element.requirements: Allows externally provided and/or usable business identifiers to be easily associated with the module.

element.short: Business version of the expansion profile
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the expansion profile when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the expansion profile author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different expansion profile instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a refrence to a particular business version of the expansion profile with the format [url]|[version].

element.short: Name for this expansion profile (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the expansion profile. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alpha-numeric type name to ensure that it is computable friendly.
element.requirements: Support human navigation and code generation.

element.definition: The status of this expansion profile. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment:
Allows filtering of expansion profiles that are appropriate for use vs. not.  
This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use a retired expansion profile without due consideration.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A boolean value to indicate that this expansion profile is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of expansion profile that are appropriate for use vs. not. This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use an experimental expansion profile in production.
element.requirements: Enables experimental content to be developed following the same lifecycle that would be used for a production-level expansion profile.

element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the expansion profile was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the expansion profile changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the expansion profile. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the expansion profile.
element.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the expansion profile is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the expansion profile. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the expansion profile. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the expansion profile.  May also allow for contact.

element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.short: Natural language description of the expansion profile
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the expansion profile from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the expansion profile was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the expansion profile as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the profile is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the profile was created).

element.short: Context the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate expansion profile instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation whether all or any of the contexts apply.
element.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for expansion profile (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the expansion profile is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the expansion profile to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use

element.short: Fix use of a code system to a particular version
element.definition: Fix use of a particular code system to a particular version.

element.short: System to have its version fixed
element.definition: The specific system for which to fix the version.
element.comment: See ''Coding.system'' for further documentation.

element.short: Specific version of the code system referred to
element.definition: The version of the code system from which codes in the expansion should be included.
How to manage the intersection between a fixed version in a value set, and this fixed version of the system in the expansion profile.

binding.description: How to manage the intersection between a fixed version in a value set, and a fixed version of the system in the expansion profile

element.definition: Code system, or a particular version of a code system to be excluded from value set expansions.
element.comment: When a system is excluded, and this makes a material difference to the expansion, the exclusion SHALL  be noted in the expansion parameters using a parameter 'excluded'.

element.short: The specific code system to be excluded
element.definition: An absolute URI which is the code system to be excluded.
element.comment: See ''Coding.system'' for further documentation.

element.short: Specific version of the code system referred to
element.definition: The version of the code system from which codes in the expansion should be excluded.
element.comment: This is used to apply version specifc exclusion contraints. If no version is specified, then all codes from the code system present in the expansion (prior to application of the expansion profile) will be excluded.
element.meaningWhenMissing: Exclusion is not version specific

element.short: Whether the expansion should include concept designations
element.definition: Controls whether concept designations are to be included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comment: ExpansionProfile.designation.include and ExpansionProfile.designation.exclude are only evaluated if includeDesignations is present and set to "true". If includeDesignations is present with a value of "true" and both ExpansionProfile.designation.include and ExpansionProfile.designation.exclude are absent, then all designations are returned in the expansion.

element.short: When the expansion profile imposes designation contraints
element.definition: A set of criteria that provide the constraints imposed on the value set expansion by including or excluding designations.
Designations to be included.
A data group for each designation to be included.
element.comment: At least one of designation.language or designation.use must be provided for each include.designation element.

constraint.human: SHALL have at least one of language or use

element.short: Human language of the designation to be included
element.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
element.comment: In the absence of a language, all designations are retained which match the designation.use parameter for this include.designation.

binding.description: A human language.

element.short: What kind of Designation to include
element.definition: Which kinds of designation to include in the expansion.
element.comment: In the absence of a use, all designations are retained which match the designation.language parameter for this include.designation element.

binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

element.definition: Designations to be excluded.
A data group for each designation to be excluded.
element.comment: At least one of designation.language or designation.use must be provided for each exclude.designation element.

constraint.human: SHALL have at least one of language or use

element.short: Human language of the designation to be excluded
element.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
element.comment: In the absence of a language, all designations are excluded which match the designation.use parameter for this exclude.designation element.

binding.description: A human language.

element.short: What kind of Designation to exclude
element.definition: Which kinds of designation to exclude from the expansion.
element.comment: In the absence of a use, all designations are retained which match the designation.language parameter for this exclude.designation element.

binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

element.short: Include or exclude the value set definition in the expansion
element.definition: Controls whether the value set definition is included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comment: The ValueSet defintion refers to all fields in the ValueSet definition apart from  ValueSet.contains. The definition is only included if includeDefinition is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude inactive concepts in the expansion
element.definition: Controls whether inactive concepts are included or excluded in value set expansions.
element.comment: Inactive codes are included if activeOnly is present and has a value of "true". Note that if the value set explicitly specifies that inactive codes are included, this property can still remove them from a specific expansion, but this parameter cannot include them if the value set excludes them.

element.short: Nested codes in the expansion or not
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion nests codes or not (i.e. ValueSet.expansion.contains.contains).
element.comment: Nesting of codes is excluded if excludeNested is present and has a value of "true".
element.requirements: Heirahical contains are useful for UI use, but not when validating. Code Generation etc. may depend on context.

element.short: Include or exclude codes which cannot be rendered in user interfaces in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes codes which cannot be displayed in user interfaces.
element.comment: Codes which cannot be used in user interfaces will be excluded if excludeNotForUI is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Include or exclude codes which are post coordinated expressions in the value set expansion
element.definition: Controls whether or not the value set expansion includes post coordinated codes.
element.comment: Post coordinated codes are excluded if excludePostCoordinated is present and has a value of "true".

element.short: Specify the language for the display element of codes in the value set expansion
element.definition: Specifies the language to be used for description in the expansions i.e. the language to be used for ValueSet.expansion.contains.display.

binding.description: A human language.

element.short: Controls behaviour of the value set expand operation when value sets are too large to be completely expanded
element.definition: If the value set being expanded is incomplete (because it is too big to expand), return a limited expansion (a subset) with an indicator that expansion is incomplete, using the extension [http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/valueset-toocostly](extension-valueset-toocostly.html).
element.comment: This field overides the default behaviour (which is to return an error). This does not apply to expansions which are unbounded. Clients SHALL process the extension [http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/valueset-toocostly](extension-valueset-toocostly.html) correctly if limitedExpansion = true.

element.definition: This records identifiers associated with this family member history record that are defined by business processes and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
element.requirements: Need to allow connection to a wider workflow.

element.definition: A protocol or questionnaire that was adhered to in whole or in part by this event.
A code specifying the status of the record of the family history of a specific family member.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: A code that identifies the status of the family history record.

element.short: The taking of a family member's history did not occur
element.definition: If true, indicates the taking of an individual family member's history did not occur. The notDone element should not be used to document negated conditions, such as a family member that did not have a condition.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it marks the family member history as a family member history that did not occur.  The more attributes are populated, the more constrained the negated statement is.  This notDone element is being evaluated and will likely be removed in a subsequent release.
element.requirements: Creating a FamilyMemberHistory where notDone is true is intended for situations where there's a need for a specific statement in the record about something not being done.  If the need is merely to indicate that a request wasn't fulfilled, that should be handled using Task.

element.definition: Describes why the family member's history is absent.
element.comment: This notDoneReason element is being evaluated and will likely be replaced in a subsequent release (e.g. dataAbsentReason).
element.requirements: This is a separate element to allow it to have a distinct binding from reasonCode.

binding.description: Codes describing the reason why a family member history was not done.

element.definition: The person who this history concerns.
The date (and possibly time) when the family member history was taken.
element.comment: This should be captured even if the same as the date on the List aggregating the full family history.
element.requirements: Allows determination of how current the summary is.

element.definition: This will either be a name or a description; e.g. "Aunt Susan", "my cousin with the red hair".
element.requirements: Allows greater ease in ensuring the same person is being talked about.

element.definition: The type of relationship this person has to the patient (father, mother, brother etc.).

binding.description: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the related person being described in the family member history.

element.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the relative is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
element.requirements: Not all relationship codes imply gender and the relative's gender can be relevant for risk assessments.

binding.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

element.definition: The actual or approximate date of birth of the relative.
element.requirements: Allows calculation of the relative's age.

element.definition: The age of the relative at the time the family member history is recorded.
element.comment: use estimatedAge to indicate whether the age is actual or not.
element.requirements: While age can be calculated from date of birth, sometimes recording age directly is more natureal for clinicians.

element.definition: If true, indicates that the age value specified is an estimated value.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the fact tha age is estimated can/should change the results of any algorithm that calculates based on the specified age.
element.requirements: Clinicians often prefer to specify an estimaged age rather than an age range.
element.meaningWhenMissing: It is unknown whether the age is an estimate or not

element.definition: Deceased flag or the actual or approximate age of the relative at the time of death for the family member history record.

mapping.map: player[classCode=LIV, determinerCode=INSTANCE].deceasedInd, deceasedDate (could be URG)  For age, you'd hang an observation off the role

element.short: Why was family member history performed?
element.definition: Describes why the family member history occurred in coded or textual form.
element.comment: Textual reasons can be caprued using reasonCode.text.

binding.description: Codes indicating why the family member history was done.

element.short: Why was family member history performed?
element.definition: Indicates a Condition, Observation, AllergyIntolerance, or QuestionnaireResponse that justifies this family member history event.
This property allows a non condition-specific note to the made about the related person. Ideally, the note would be in the condition property, but this is not always possible.

element.short: Condition that the related person had
element.definition: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.
element.comment: If none of the conditions listed have an outcome of "death" specified, that indicates that none of the specified conditions are known to have been the primary cause of death.

element.definition: The actual condition specified. Could be a coded condition (like MI or Diabetes) or a less specific string like 'cancer' depending on how much is known about the condition and the capabilities of the creating system.

binding.description: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

element.definition: Indicates what happened as a result of this condition.  If the condition resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

binding.description: The result of the condition for the patient; e.g. death, permanent disability, temporary disability, etc.

element.definition: Either the age of onset, range of approximate age or descriptive string can be recorded.  For conditions with multiple occurrences, this describes the first known occurrence.
element.requirements: Age of onset of a condition in relatives is predictive of risk for the patient.

mapping.map: inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="Subject Age at measurement", value<Diagnosis].value[@xsi:typeCode='TS' or 'IVL_TS']  Use originalText for string

element.definition: An area where general notes can be placed about this specific condition.

Supports basic workflow.

binding.description: Indicates whether this flag is active and needs to be displayed to a user, or whether it is no longer needed or entered in error.

element.comment: If non coded, use CodeableConcept.text.  This element should always be included in the narrative.

binding.description: Detail codes identifying specific flagged issues.

element.definition: The patient, location, group , organization , or practitioner, etc. this is about record this flag is associated with.

element.definition: The person, organization or device that created the flag.

element.comment: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.

element.short: proposed | accepted | planned | in-progress | on-target | ahead-of-target | behind-target | sustaining | achieved | on-hold | cancelled | entered-in-error | rejected
element.definition: Indicates whether the goal has been reached and is still considered relevant.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.
element.requirements: Allows measuring outcome and whether goal needs to be further tracked.

binding.description: Indicates whether the goal has been met and is still being targeted

mapping.map: .statusCode in-progress = active (classCode = OBJ) achieved = complete sustaining = active (classCode=OBJC) cancelled = aborted

element.definition: Indicates a category the goal falls within.
element.requirements: Allows goals to be filtered and sorted.

binding.description: Codes for grouping and sorting goals

element.definition: Identifies the mutually agreed level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the goal.
element.comment: Extensions are available to track priorities as established by each participant (i.e. Priority from the patient's perspective, different practitioners' perspectives, family member's perspectives)The ordinal extension on Coding can be used to convey a numerically comparable ranking to priority.  (Keep in mind that different coding systems may use a "low value=important".
element.requirements: Used for sorting and presenting goals.

binding.description: The level of importance associated with a goal

element.definition: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".
element.comment: If no code is available, use CodeableConcept.text.
element.requirements: Without a description of what's trying to be achieved, element has no purpose.

binding.description: Codes providing the details of a particular goal.  This will generally be system or implementation guide-specific.  In many systems, only the text element will be used.

element.short: Who this goal is intended for
element.definition: Identifies the patient, group or organization for whom the goal is being established.
element.requirements: Subject is optional to support annonymized reporting.

element.definition: The date or event after which the goal should begin being pursued.
element.requirements: Goals can be established prior to there being an intention to start pursuing them; e.g. Goals for post-surgical recovery established prior to surgery.

binding.description: Codes describing events that can trigger the initiation of a goal

element.definition: Indicates what should be done by when.
element.requirements: Allows the progress of the goal to be monitored against an observation or due date.

constraint.human: Goal.target.measure is required if Goal.target.detail is populated

element.short: The parameter whose value is being tracked
element.definition: The parameter whose value is being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

binding.description: Codes to identify the value being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

element.short: The target value to be achieved
element.definition: The target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds, 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or above the low value.

binding.description: Codes to identify the target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal.

element.definition: Indicates either the date or the duration after start by which the goal should be met.
element.requirements: Identifies when the goal should be evaluated.

element.definition: Identifies when the current status.  I.e. When initially created, when achieved, when cancelled, etc.
element.comment: To see the date for past statuses, query history.

element.definition: Captures the reason for the current status.
element.comment: This will typically be captured for statuses such as rejected, on-hold or cancelled, but could be present for others.

element.definition: Indicates whose goal this is - patient goal, practitioner goal, etc.
element.comment: This is the individual reponsible for establishing the goal, not necessarily who recorded it.  (For that, use the Provenance resource.).

element.definition: The identified conditions and other health record elements that are intended to be addressed by the goal.
element.requirements: Allows specific goals to explicitly linked to the concerns they're dealing with - makes the goal more understandable.

element.definition: Any comments related to the goal.
element.comment: May be used for progress notes, concerns or other related information that doesn't actually describe the goal itself.
element.requirements: There's a need to capture information about the goal that doesn't actually describe the goal.

element.short: What result was achieved regarding the goal?
element.definition: Identifies the change (or lack of change) at the point when the status of the goal is assessed.
element.comment: Note that this should not duplicate the goal status.
element.requirements: Outcome tracking is a key aspect of care planning.

binding.description: The result of the goal; e.g. "25% increase in shoulder mobility", "Anxiety reduced to moderate levels".  "15 kg weight loss sustained over 6 months"

element.definition: Details of what's changed (or not changed).
element.comment: The goal outcome is independent of the outcome of the related activities.  For example, if the Goal is to achieve a target body weight of 150 lb and a care plan activity is defined to diet, then the care plan’s activity outcome could be calories consumed whereas goal outcome is an observation for the actual body weight measured.
element.requirements: Outcome tracking is a key aspect of care planning.

element.short: Definition of an graph of resources
element.definition: A formal computable definition of a graph of resources - that is, a coherent set of resources that form a graph by following references. The Graph Definition resource defines a set and makes rules about the set.

element.short: Logical URI to reference this graph definition (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this graph definition is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the graph definition. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
element.comment: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid:, but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same url if they have a distinct version.
element.requirements: Allows the graph definition to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier.

element.short: Business version of the graph definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the graph definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different graph definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a refrence to a particular business version of the graph definition with the format [url]|[version].

element.short: Name for this graph definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the graph definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alpha-numeric type name to ensure that it is computable friendly.
element.requirements: Support human navigation and code generation.

element.definition: The status of this graph definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment:
Allows filtering of graph definitions that are appropriate for use vs. not.  
This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use a retired graph definition without due consideration.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A boolean value to indicate that this graph definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of graph definition that are appropriate for use vs. not. This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use an experimental graph definition in production.
element.requirements: Enables experimental content to be developed following the same lifecycle that would be used for a production-level graph definition.

element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the graph definition was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the graph definition changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the graph definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the graph definition.
element.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the graph definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the graph definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the graph definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the graph definition.  May also allow for contact.

element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.short: Natural language description of the graph definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the graph definition from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the graph definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the graph definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the profile is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the profile was created).

element.short: Context the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate graph definition instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation whether all or any of the contexts apply.
element.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

element.short: Intended jurisdiction for graph definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the graph definition is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the graph definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use

element.short: Why this graph definition is defined
element.definition: Explaination of why this graph definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the graph definition Instead  it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this graph definition.

element.short: Type of resource at which the graph starts
element.definition: The type of FHIR resource at which instances of this graph start.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR.

element.definition: The profile that describes the use of the base resource.
element.comment: The code does not include the '$' prefix that is always included in the URL when the operation is invoked.

element.short: Links this graph makes rules about
element.definition: Links this graph makes rules about.

element.short: Path in the resource that contains the link
element.definition: Path in the resource that contains the link.
element.comment: The path can be a literal path (e.g. Observation.subject), or it can be a query for reverse links (e.g. Provenance?target=[id]).

element.definition: Which slice (if profiled).
Minimum occurrences for this link.
Maximum occurrences for this link.
Information about why this link is of interest in this graph definition.
Potential target for the link.

element.short: Type of resource this link refers to
element.definition: Type of resource this link refers to.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR.

element.definition: Profile for the target resource.
Compartment Consistency Rules.
Identifies the compartment.

binding.description: Identifies a compartment

element.definition: identical | matching | different | no-rule | custom.

binding.description: How a compartment must be linked

element.short: Custom rule, as a FHIRPath expression
element.definition: Custom rule, as a FHIRPath expression.
Documentation for FHIRPath expression.
Additional links from target resource.

Represents a defined collection of entities that may be discussed or acted upon collectively but which are not expected to act collectively and are not formally or legally recognized; i.e. a collection of entities that isn't an Organization.

constraint.human: Can only have members if group is "actual"

element.definition: A unique business identifier for this group.
element.requirements: Allows the group to be referenced from external specifications.

element.short: Whether this group's record is in active use
element.definition: Indicates whether the record for the group is available for use or is merely being retained for historical purposes.
element.requirements: Need to be able to mark a group record as not to be used because it was created in error or is otherwise no longer available (e.g. a herd that no longer exists).

element.short: person | animal | practitioner | device | medication | substance
element.definition: Identifies the broad classification of the kind of resources the group includes.
element.comment: Group members SHALL be of the appropriate resource type (Patient for person or animal; or Practitioner, Device, Medicaiton or Substance for the other types.).
element.requirements: Identifies what type of resources the group is made up of.

binding.description: Types of resources that are part of group

mapping.map: person: ./classCode="PSN"  animal: ./classCode="ANM"  device: ./classCode="DEV"  medication: ./classCode="MMAT" and ./playedRole[isNormalRole() and classCode="THER"]  food: ./classCode="FOOD"

element.definition: If true, indicates that the resource refers to a specific group of real individuals.  If false, the group defines a set of intended individuals.
element.requirements: There are use-cases for groups that define specific collections of individuals, and other groups that define "types" of intended individuals.  The requirements for both kinds of groups are similar, so we use a single resource, distinguished by this flag.

element.definition: Provides a specific type of resource the group includes; e.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.
element.comment: This would generally be omitted for Person resources.

binding.description: Kind of particular resource; e.g. cow, syringe, lake, etc.

element.definition: A label assigned to the group for human identification and communication.
element.requirements: Used to identify the group in human communication.

element.definition: A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group.
element.comment: Note that the quantity may be less than the number of members if some of the members are not active.
element.requirements: Group size is a common defining characteristic.

element.definition: Identifies the traits shared by members of the group.
element.comment: All the identified characteristics must be true for an entity to a member of the group.
element.requirements: Needs to be a generic mechanism for identifying what individuals can be part of a group.

mapping.map: ./playedRole[isNormalRole()]/participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode="SBJ"]/act[isNormalAct and classCode="OBS" and moodCode="EVN"]

element.definition: A code that identifies the kind of trait being asserted.
element.requirements: Need a formal way of identifying the characteristic being described.

binding.description: List of characteristics used to describe group members; e.g. gender, age, owner, location, etc.

element.definition: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group.
element.comment: For Range, it means members of the group have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.
element.requirements: The value of the characteristic is what determines group membership.

binding.description: Value of descriptive member characteristic; e.g. red, male, pneumonia, Caucasian, etc.

element.definition: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group.
element.comment: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications cannot wrongly include excluded members as included or vice versa.
element.requirements: Sometimes group membership is determined by characteristics not possessed.

element.short: Period over which characteristic is tested
element.definition: The period over which the characteristic is tested; e.g. the patient had an operation during the month of June.

element.short: Who or what is in group
element.definition: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.
element.requirements: Often the only thing of interest about a group is "who's in it".

element.definition: A reference to the entity that is a member of the group. Must be consistent with Group.type.

element.short: Period member belonged to the group
element.definition: The period that the member was in the group, if known.
element.requirements: Need to track who was in a group at a  particular time.
element.meaningWhenMissing: The member is in the group at this time

element.short: If member is no longer in group
element.definition: A flag to indicate that the member is no longer in the group, but previously may have been a member.
element.requirements: Sometimes you don't know when someone stopped being in a group, but not when.

resource.name: GuidanceResponse
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven International (Clinical Decision Support)

element.short: The formal response to a guidance request
element.definition: A guidance response is the formal response to a guidance request, including any output parameters returned by the evaluation, as well as the description of any proposed actions to be taken.

element.short: The id of the request associated with this response, if any
element.definition: The id of the request associated with this response. If an id was given as part of the request, it will be reproduced here to enable the requester to more easily identify the response in a multi-request scenario.
Allows a service to provide a unique, business identifier for the response.

element.short: A reference to a knowledge module
element.definition: A reference to the knowledge module that was invoked.

element.short: success | data-requested | data-required | in-progress | failure | entered-in-error
element.definition: The status of the response. If the evaluation is completed successfully, the status will indicate success. However, in order to complete the evaluation, the engine may require more information. In this case, the status will be data-required, and the response will contain a description of the additional required information. If the evaluation completed successfully, but the engine determines that a potentially more accurate response could be provided if more data was available, the status will be data-requested, and the response will contain a description of the additional requested information.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: The status of a guidance response

element.short: Patient the request was performed for
element.definition: The patient for which the request was processed.

element.short: Encounter or Episode during which the response was returned
element.definition: Allows the context of the guidance response to be provided if available. In a service context, this would likely be unavailable.

element.short: When the guidance response was processed
element.definition: Indicates when the guidance response was processed.
Provides a reference to the device that performed the guidance.

Indicates the reason the request was initiated. This is typically provided as a parameter to the evaluation and echoed by the service, although for some use cases, such as subscription- or event-based scenarios, it may provide an indication of the cause for the response.
Provides a mechanism to communicate additional information about the response.

element.short: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts
element.definition: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts. As part of evaluating the request, the engine may produce informational or warning messages. These messages will be provided by this element.

element.short: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any
element.definition: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any. Many modules will result in the return of specific resources such as procedure or communication requests that are returned as part of the operation result. However, modules may define specific outputs that would be returned as the result of the evaluation, and these would be returned in this element.
The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

If the evaluation could not be completed due to lack of information, or additional information would potentially result in a more accurate response, this element will a description of the data required in order to proceed with the evaluation. A subsequent request to the service should include this data.

element.short: The details of a healthcare service available at a location
element.definition: The details of a healthcare service available at a location.
External identifiers for this item.

element.short: Whether this healthcareservice is in active use
element.definition: Whether this healthcareservice record is in active use.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it may be used to mark that the resource was created in error.

element.definition: The organization that provides this healthcare service.
element.comment: This property is recommended to be the same as the Location's managingOrganization, and if not provided should be interpreted as such. If the Location does not have a managing Organization, then this property should be populated.

element.short: Broad category of service being performed or delivered
element.definition: Identifies the broad category of service being performed or delivered.
element.comment: Selecting a Service Category then determines the list of relevant service types that can be selected in the primary service type.

binding.description: A category of the service(s) that could be provided.

element.short: Type of service that may be delivered or performed
element.definition: The specific type of service that may be delivered or performed.

binding.description: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty).

element.definition: Collection of specialties handled by the service site. This is more of a medical term.

binding.description: A specialty that a healthcare service may provide.

element.short: Location(s) where service may be provided
element.definition: The location(s) where this healthcare service may be provided.

element.short: Description of service as presented to a consumer while searching
element.definition: Further description of the service as it would be presented to a consumer while searching.

element.short: Additional description and/or any specific issues not covered elsewhere
element.definition: Any additional description of the service and/or any specific issues not covered by the other attributes, which can be displayed as further detail under the serviceName.
element.comment: Would expect that a user would not see this information on a search results, and it would only be available when viewing the complete details of the service.

element.short: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields
element.definition: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields.

element.short: Facilitates quick identification of the service
element.definition: If there is a photo/symbol associated with this HealthcareService, it may be included here to facilitate quick identification of the service in a list.

element.short: Contacts related to the healthcare service
element.definition: List of contacts related to this specific healthcare service.
element.comment: If this is empty, then refer to the location's contacts.

element.short: Location(s) service is inteded for/available to
element.definition: The location(s) that this service is available to (not where the service is provided).
element.comment: The locations referenced by the coverage area can include both specific locations, including areas, and also conceptual domains too (mode = kind), such as a physical area (tri-state area) and some other attribute (covered by Example Care Organization). These types of Locations are often not managed by any specific organization. This could also include generic locations such as "in-home".

element.short: Conditions under which service is available/offered
element.definition: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.
element.comment: The provision means being commissioned by, contractually obliged or financially sourced. Types of costings that may apply to this healthcare service, such if the service may be available for free, some discounts available, or fees apply.

binding.description: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.

element.short: Specific eligibility requirements required to use the service
element.definition: Does this service have specific eligibility requirements that need to be met in order to use the service?

binding.description: Coded values underwhich a specific service is made available.

element.short: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service
element.definition: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service.
element.comment: The description of service eligibility should, in general, not exceed one or two paragraphs. It should be sufficient for a prospective consumer to determine if they are likely to be eligible or not. Where eligibility requirements and conditions are complex, it may simply be noted that an eligibility assessment is required. Where eligibility is determined by an outside source, such as an Act of Parliament, this should be noted, preferably with a reference to a commonly available copy of the source document such as a web page.

element.short: Program Names that categorize the service
element.definition: Program Names that can be used to categorize the service.
element.comment: Programs are often defined externally to an Organization, commonly by governments; e.g. Home and Community Care Programs, Homeless Program, ….

element.definition: Collection of characteristics (attributes).
element.comment: These could be such things as is wheelchair accessible.

binding.description: A custom attribute that could be provided at a service (e.g. Wheelchair accessibiliy).

element.short: Ways that the service accepts referrals
element.definition: Ways that the service accepts referrals, if this is not provided then it is implied that no referral is required.

binding.description: The methods of referral can be used when referring to a specific HealthCareService resource.

element.short: If an appointment is required for access to this service
element.definition: Indicates whether or not a prospective consumer will require an appointment for a particular service at a site to be provided by the Organization. Indicates if an appointment is required for access to this service.

element.short: Times the Service Site is available
element.definition: A collection of times that the Service Site is available.
element.comment: More detailed availability information may be provided in associated Schedule/Slot resources.

element.short: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
element.definition: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

binding.description: The days of the week.

element.definition: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) e.g. 24 hour service.

element.short: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: The opening time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.
element.comment: The timezone is expected to be for where this HealthcareService is provided at.

element.short: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: The closing time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.
element.comment: The timezone is expected to be for where this HealthcareService is provided at.

element.short: Not available during this time due to provided reason
element.definition: The HealthcareService is not available during this period of time due to the provided reason.

element.short: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available
element.definition: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available.
Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) from this date.

A description of site availability exceptions, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as details in the available Times and not available Times.

element.short: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the location
element.definition: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the specific healthcare services defined at this resource.
element.requirements: Organizations may have different systems covering different services at the different locations and need to be able to define the technical connection details for how to connect to them, and for what purpose.

element.definition: A text description of the DICOM SOP instances selected in the ImagingManifest; or the reason for, or significance of, the selection.
Unique identifier of the DICOM Key Object Selection (KOS) that this resource represents.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP Instance is always assigned with a unique identifier (UID).

mapping.map: (0008,0018) - SOP Instance UID (of the Key Object Selection SOP Class)

element.definition: A patient resource reference which is the patient subject of all DICOM SOP Instances in this ImagingManifest.
element.comment: SOP instances selected in the ImagingManifest can be from different studies, but must be of the same patient.
element.requirements: SOP Instances in ImagingManifest must be from the same patient.

mapping.map: (0010,0010) - Patient Name (0010,0020) - Patient ID (0010,0021) - Issuer of Patient ID

element.short: Time when the selection of instances was made
element.definition: Date and time when the selection of the referenced instances were made. It is (typically) different from the creation date of the selection resource, and from dates associated with the referenced instances (e.g. capture time of the referenced image).
element.requirements: Date and time when the selection was made can be important to understand the content of selection.

element.definition: Author of ImagingManifest. It can be a human author or a device which made the decision of the SOP instances selected. For example, a radiologist selected a set of imaging SOP instances to attach in a diagnostic report, and a CAD application may author a selection to describe SOP instances it used to generate a detection conclusion.
element.requirements: Track the selection decision maker.

element.definition:
Free text narrative description of the ImagingManifest.  
The value may be derived from the DICOM Standard Part 16, CID-7010 descriptions (e.g. Best in Set, Complete Study Content). Note that those values cover the wide range of uses of the DICOM Key Object Selection object, several of which are not supported by ImagingManifest. Specifically, there is no expected behavior associated with descriptions that suggest referenced images be removed or not used.
element.comment: Free text narrative description of the ImagingManifest.
element.requirements: Need to provide a narrative description of the SOP instances in the selection.

mapping.map: (0040,A160) - Text Value SR content item immediately under the root item, concept name code = (113012, DCM, "Key Object Description")

element.short: Study identity of the selected instances
element.definition: Study identity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
element.comment: Study component represents the study level identity and locator information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection. It is the top level identity of the hierarchical identification of the instances.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the study level provide a means of retrieving the entire study.

element.definition: Study instance UID of the SOP instances in the selection.
element.requirements: Study instance UID is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

element.definition: Reference to the Imaging Study in FHIR form.
element.requirements: Used to retrieve the ImagingStudy that contain the images referenced in the Imaging ObjectSelection.study.

element.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.
element.requirements: Access methods for viewing (e.g. IHE’s IID profile) or retrieving (e.g., DICOM’s WADO-URI and WADO-RS) the study or the study’s series or instances. The study-level baseLocation applies to each series in the study, unless overridden in series by a series-level baseLocation of the same type.

element.short: Series identity of the selected instances
element.definition: Series identity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
element.comment: Series component represents the series level identity and locator information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the series level provides a means of retrieving the entire series.

element.definition: Series instance UID of the SOP instances in the selection.
element.requirements: Series instance UID is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

element.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.
element.requirements: Access methods for retrieving (e.g., DICOM’s WADO-URI and WADO-RS) the series or the series’ instances. A baseLocation specified at the series level has precedence over a baseLocation of the same type specified at the study level.

element.definition: Identity and locating information of the selected DICOM SOP instances.
element.comment: SOP Instance component identify the instance selected, along with the study and series identities to form the DICOM identity hierarchy.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. This is the instance level identity of the instance in the selection.

element.definition: SOP class UID of the selected instance.
element.comment: SOP class UID identifies the type of the selected instances, e.g. CT image, Gray scale softcopy presentation state, ECG waveform, etc.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances can be an image or other data object. The SOP class UID provide the accurate information about what type the instance is.

element.definition: SOP Instance UID of the selected instance.
element.comment: SOP instance UID identifies the instance.
element.requirements: SOP instance UID is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instance in the selection.

element.short: A set of images produced in single study (one or more series of references images)
element.definition: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

mapping.map: Reference IHE radiology TF vol 2 table 4.14-1

element.short: Formal DICOM identifier for the study
element.definition: Formal identifier for the study.

Accession Number is an identifier related to some aspect of imaging workflow and data management. Usage may vary across different institutions.  See for instance [IHE Radiology Technical Framework Volume 1 Appendix A](http://www.ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/Radiology/IHE_RAD_TF_Rev13.0_Vol1_FT_2014-07-30.pdf).
Other identifiers for the study.
Availability of study (online, offline, or nearline).

binding.description: Availability of the resource

element.short: All series modality if actual acquisition modalities
element.definition: A list of all the Series.ImageModality values that are actual acquisition modalities, i.e. those in the DICOM Context Group 29 (value set OID 1.2.840.10008.6.1.19).

binding.description: Type of acquired data in the instance

element.definition: The patient imaged in the study.
The encounter or episode at which the request is initiated.
Date and time the study started.
A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.
element.requirements: To support grouped procedures (one imaging study supporting multiple ordered procedures, e.g. chest/abdomen/pelvis CT).

element.definition: The requesting/referring physician.
Who read the study and interpreted the images or other content.

The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.
element.comment: Typical endpoint types include DICOM WADO-RS, which is used to retrieve DICOM instances in native or rendered (e.g., JPG, PNG), formats using a RESTful API; DICOM WADO-URI, which can similarly retrieve native or rendered instances, except using an HTTP query-based approach; DICOM QIDO-RS, which allows RESTful query for DICOM information without retrieving the actual instances; or IHE Invoke Image Display (IID), which provides standard invocation of an imaging web viewer.
element.requirements: Access methods for viewing (e.g., IHE’s IID profile) or retrieving (e.g., DICOM’s WADO-URI and WADO-RS) the study or the study’s series or instances. The study-level baseLocation applies to each series in the study, unless overridden in series by a series-level baseLocation of the same type.

element.definition: Number of Series in the Study. This value given may be larger than the number of series elements this Resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any series elements are present.

Number of SOP Instances in Study. This value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.
A reference to the performed Procedure.
The code for the performed procedure type.

binding.description: The performed procedure type

element.definition: Description of clinical condition indicating why the ImagingStudy was requested.

binding.description: The reason for the study

element.definition: Institution-generated description or classification of the Study performed.

element.short: Each study has one or more series of instances
element.definition: Each study has one or more series of images or other content.

element.short: Formal DICOM identifier for this series
element.definition: Formal identifier for this series.
The numeric identifier of this series in the study.

element.short: The modality of the instances in the series
element.definition: The modality of this series sequence.

binding.description: Type of acquired data in the instance

element.short: A short human readable summary of the series
element.definition: A description of the series.

Number of SOP Instances in the Study. The value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.
Availability of series (online, offline or nearline).

binding.description: Availability of the resource

element.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.
element.comment: Typical endpoint types include DICOM WADO-RS, which is used to retrieve DICOM instances in native or rendered (e.g., JPG, PNG) formats using a RESTful API; DICOM WADO-URI, which can similarly retrieve native or rendered instances, except using an HTTP query-based approach; and DICOM QIDO-RS, which allows RESTful query for DICOM information without retrieving the actual instances.
element.requirements: Access methods for retrieving (e.g., DICOM’s WADO-URI and WADO-RS) the series or the series’ instances. A baseLocation specified at the series level has precedence over a baseLocation of the same type specified at the study level.

element.definition: The anatomic structures examined. See DICOM Part 16 Annex L (http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite may indicate the laterality of body part imaged; if so, it shall be consistent with any content of ImagingStudy.series.laterality.

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

element.definition: The laterality of the (possibly paired) anatomic structures examined. E.g., the left knee, both lungs, or unpaired abdomen. If present, shall be consistent with any laterality information indicated in ImagingStudy.series.bodySite.

binding.description: Codes describing body site laterality (left, right, etc.).

element.definition: The date and time the series was started.

The physician or operator (often the radiology technician)  who performed the series. The performer is recorded at the series level, since each series in a study may be performed by a different practitioner, at different times, and using different devices. A series may be performed by multiple practitioners.

element.short: A single SOP instance from the series
element.definition: A single SOP instance within the series, e.g. an image, or presentation state.

element.short: Formal DICOM identifier for this instance
element.definition: Formal identifier for this image or other content.

element.short: The number of this instance in the series
element.definition: The number of instance in the series.
DICOM instance  type.
The description of the instance.
element.comment: Particularly for post-acquisition analytic objects, such as SR, presentation states, value mapping, etc.

resource.name: Immunization
resource.publisher: Health Level Seven International (Public Health and Emergency Response)

element.definition: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

constraint.human: If immunization was administered (notGiven=false) then explanation.reasonNotGiven SHALL be absent.
If immunization was not administered (notGiven=true) then there SHALL be no reaction nor explanation.reason present

element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.
Indicates the current status of the vaccination event.
element.comment:
Will generally be set to show that the immunization has been completed.

This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: A set of codes indicating the current status of an Immunization

element.short: Flag for whether immunization was given
element.definition: Indicates if the vaccination was or was not given.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it indicates that an immunization didn't happen.

element.definition: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

binding.description: The code for vaccine product administered

element.definition: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.
The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.
Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.
element.comment: When immunizations are given a specific date and time should always be known.   When immunizations are patient reported, a specific date might not be known.  Although partial dates are allowed, an adult patient might not be able to recall the year a childhood immunization was given.

element.short: Indicates context the data was recorded in
element.definition: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.
element.comment: Reflects the “reliability” of the content.

element.short: Indicates the source of a secondarily reported record
element.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.
element.comment: Should not be populated if primarySource = True, will not be required even if primarySource = False.

binding.description: The source of the data for a record which is not from a primary source.

mapping.map:
.participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PAT] (this syntax for self-reported)
.participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=LIC] (this syntax for health care professional)
.participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PRS] (this syntax for family member)

element.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

mapping.map: RXA-27  (or RXA-11, deprecated as of v2.7)

element.definition: Name of vaccine manufacturer.
Lot number of the  vaccine product.
Date vaccine batch expires.
Body site where vaccine was administered.

binding.description: The site at which the vaccine was administered

element.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

binding.description: The route by which the vaccine was administered

element.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.
Indicates who or what performed the event.

element.short: What type of performance was done
element.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

binding.description: The role a practitioner plays in the immunization event

element.definition: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action.
Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.
Reasons why a vaccine was or was not administered.
Reasons why a vaccine was administered.

binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was administered

element.definition: Reason why a vaccine was not administered.

binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was not administered

element.short: Details of a reaction that follows immunization
element.definition: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.
